meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Cathy Whitehead Tony Burrell Jeremy Horowitz Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #4120.

div.div: (Kermit the Frog: Hi-ho, Kermit the Frog here. You know, finally, after 18 seasons, Jeopardy! is letting another species do a clue? Hm! 'Bout time, don't you think? Yeah, me too.)

td.p: Cathy Whitehead, a homemaker from Houston, Texas
Tony Burrell, an attorney from Ashburn, Virginia
Jeremy Horowitz, a lawyer from Santa Monica, California (whose 1-day cash winnings total $27,100)

tr.td: PRESIDENTIAL APBs
SUPREMES HITS IN OTHER WORDS
WIZARDS
TURKEY
MEAT & POTATOES
PASS THE "P"s, PLEASE

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_3_3', 'clue_J_3_3_stuck', '(Alex: And that\'s why it lasted only one year.
[Laughter]
(Alex: It was called The Wizard of Oz.)
...
(Alex: [Before giving the Double Jeopardy! Round categories] Let me tell you how easily forgotten my first television quiz show in the United States is. I referred to it a few moments ago as The Wizard of Oz. I had forgotten it was called [*]. Was it me or was it the show?)
[Laughter]
(Alex: It\'s the show.)

The Wizard of Odds

Triple Stumper
')

JeremyTonyCathy
Triple Stumper
')

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
